column1: {{disambig-more|{{PAGENAME}}|[[{{PAGENAME}} (disambiguation)]]}}
[[Image:The Return of the King 1st edition.jpg|thumb|<small>The cover of the 1st edition of ''The Return of the King''.</small>]]
'''''The Return of the King''''' is the third and final volume of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''
column2: following ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'' and ''[[The Two Towers]]''.

column1: ==Book V==
[[File:J.R.R. Tolkien - The Return of the King.jpg|left|thumb|<small>Tolkien's design for the dust-jacket of ''The Return of the King''
column2: depicting empty throne of [[Gondor]].</small>]]

column1: The Return of the King
column2: being the third and final part of J.R.R. Tolkien's trilogy - The Lord of the Rings - which came out on October 20
column3: 1955. The story begins as Pippin is in [[Rohan]]
column4: reunited with the remnants of the [[Fellowship of the Ring]]. He steals Saruman's ''[[Palantíri|palantír]]'' and sees that [[Sauron]] will attack [[Minas Tirith]]. Then [[Gandalf]] delivers news to the steward of Gondor that war is imminent. Gandalf brings [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] with him
column5: who enters the service of the steward. [[Aragorn]] by his courage and leadership proves himself a worthy ruler of men. He is destined to find a lost army of men now dead yet entrapped in a curse set forth long ago by their own disobedience
column6: in the place known as the paths of the dead. The remnants of the Fellowship lead the forces of Gondor and Rohan in defence of Gondor's capital city
column8: resulting in the cataclysmic [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]].  Those characters that manage to survive the battle are led by [[Aragorn]] on a assuredly suicidal feint-attack against the Black Gates of Mordor
column9: partly to distract Sauron from defending his other borders so that Frodo and Sam can gain a clear passage into Mordor. Aragorn's company now surrounds the Black Gates of the Morannon exchanging idle words with the Mouth of Sauron.

column1: ===Chapters===
{{rotkchapters}}
*'''I - [[Minas Tirith (chapter)|Minas Tirith]]''' - Gandalf with Pippin arrive in Minas Tirith; they talk with [[Denethor]]; Pippin enters the service of the steward.
*'''II - [[The Passing of the Grey Company]]''' - Follows Aragorn
column2: Legolas and Gimli as they pass through the paths of the dead between Rohan and Gondor.

column1: *'''III - [[The Muster of Rohan]]''' - Rohan prepares for war; Merry heads off for Minas Tirith
column2: on a horse with a rider who calls himself Dernhelm.

column1: *'''IV - [[The Siege of Gondor]]''' - Back to Gandalf and Pippin
column2: and the preparations of the city of Minas Tirith for the attack by the armies of Mordor; Minas Tirith is besieged; chapter ends with the gate of Minas Tirith broken
column3: and the army of Rohan finally arriving.

column1: *'''V - [[The Ride of the Rohirrim]]''' - The Rohirrim pass through the Druadan Forest with the aid of the wild men who live there
column2: that are led by Ghan-buri-Ghan; the army arrives in Minas Tirith. (as seen from their point of view)

column1: *'''VI - [[The Battle of the Pelennor Fields]]''' - Armies of Rohan and Gondor fight the armies of Mordor
column2: Rhun and Harad as described in [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]]; Merry and Éowyn help to kill the chief of the Nazgul.

column1: *'''VII - [[The Pyre of Denethor]]''' - Denethor goes mad and tries to burn Faramir alive; he is saved by Gandalf; Denethor then sets fire to himself. They discover that Denethor has been using a ''palantir''.
*'''VIII - [[The Houses of Healing]]''' - Merry
column2: Faramir
column3: Éowyn and many others are injured and placed in the houses of healing; Aragorn uses [[Athelas|kingsfoil]] to help treat the injured.

column1: *'''IX - [[The Last Debate]]''' - Gimli and Legolas meet Merry and Pippin again; the captains of the west hold a counsel on their next action; they decide to send 7000 men against Mordor to march on the Black Gate.
*'''X - [[The Black Gate Opens]]''' - The army
column2: with Gandalf
column5: Legolas and Pippin (but not Merry) marches to the black gate. The Mouth of Sauron comes out to discuss terms
column6: and presents tokens which were owned by Frodo; he then departs and the army of Mordor attacks them.

column1: ==Book VI==
In the meanwhile
column2: the brave and loyal [[Samwise Gamgee]] (who for a short time has himself become the ring-bearer) enables the long-suffering [[Frodo Baggins]] to navigate the barren wasteland of Mordor. For part of the way they are captured by a company of orcs and must pretend to be orcs before they are able to escape. The company
column4: finally reach the [[Cracks of Doom|Crack of Doom]]
column5: where [[the One Ring]] is destroyed along with [[Gollum]]
column6: freeing [[Middle-earth]] from [[Sauron]]'s power forever. This happens when Frodo at the last moment decides to keep the ring rather than destroy it
column7: and is attacked by Gollum who bites off Frodo's finger to take the ring
column9: and falls into the lava while still holding the ring. Frodo and Sam are rescued by the giant eagles who Gandalf rides to Mount Doom
column10: from the black gates of Morannon. After Sauron is defeated
column11: his armies at the black gates flee
column12: and the men of Gondor and Rohan are victorious in the battle.

column1: Aragorn is crowned King of Gondor at Minas Tirith. After a series of goodbyes
column2: the [[Hobbits|Hobbit]]s return home
column3: only to find [[the Shire]] under the control of 'sharky' who they find out is [[Saruman]]
column4: diminished in power but not in malevolence. [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]]
column5: now experienced warriors of [[Rohan]] and [[Gondor]] respectively
column6: take the lead in setting things right again
column7: and lead an uprising of hobbits against Saruman
column8: freeing the shire. Time passes. The Shire heals
column9: but Frodo does not. Eventually Frodo departs for the [[Undying Lands]] to find healing
column12: Merry and Pippin watch them depart and return home in silence. Sam is greeted by his wife Rose and his daughter Elanor. The last line of the book Sam says to Rose; "Well

column1: ===Chapters===
*'''I - [[The Tower of Cirith Ungol]]''' - Sam goes to find Frodo in the orc tower.
*'''II - [[The Land of Shadow]]''' - Sam and Frodo make their way into Mordor; they are captured by an orc company
*'''III - [[Mount Doom (chapter)|Mount Doom]]''' - Frodo and Sam reach Mount Doom; the final battle for the ring between Gollum and Frodo.
*'''IV - [[The Field of Cormallen]]''' - The story returns to the Field of Cormallen
column2: continuing from Book Five
column3: chapter X; the eagles arrive; Captains of the west victorious; Frodo and Sam rescued by Gandalf; all the company meets again in Ithilien

column1: *'''V - [[The Steward and the King]]''' - chapter begins in Minas Tirith at the Houses of Healing after the armies departed for the black gate; Éowyn taken to see Faramir
column2: Merry is also in Minas Tirith; later they see the arrival of the armies with Aragorn
column3: Gandalf and the four hobbits; Gandalf crowns Aragorn King of Gondor; Aragorn makes Faramir prince of ithilien and keeps the office of steward; Gandalf takes Aragorn to Mount Mindolluin to survey the lands of his kingdom. On midsummers eve Elrond
column5: Arwen and the elves arrive in the city from the north; wedding of Aragorn and Arwen.

column1: *'''VI - [[Many Partings]]''' - The company rides north to Rohan
column2: then Isengard
column3: where Gimli and Legolas head north through Fangorn
column5: the rest of the company heads north where they meet Saruman and Wormtongue who were just released from Isengard; Galadriel and the Lothlórien elves leave over the pass of Caradhras; the hobbits and Gandalf then arrive in Rivendell.

column1: *'''VII - [[Homeward Bound]]''' - The hobbits and Gandalf travel to Bree where they stay at the Prancing Pony
column2: and are told by Butterbur that there has been trouble in Bree while they have been away.

column1: *'''VIII - [[The Scouring of the Shire]]''' - The hobbits arrive in the Shire to find it taken over by 'the Chief' or 'Sharkey' at Bag End; Battle of Bywater; the hobbits find Saruman and Wormtongue at Bag End; Wormtongue kills Saruman
column2: and is then killed himself by hobbit archers.

column1: *'''IX - [[The Grey Havens]]''' - cleaning up of the shire; several years pass; Sam and Frodo meet the elves and Bilbo travelling west through the Shire
column2: they travel to the Grey Havens where they meet Gandalf
column3: and Merry and Pippin arrive; Frodo
column5: Gandalf and the elves set sail to the west; Sam returns to Rose and their daughter Elanor at Bag End.

column1: ==Title==

Tolkien conceived of ''The Lord of the Rings'' as a single volume comprising six sections he called "books" and extensive appendices. The original publisher made the decision to split the work into three parts
column2: publishing the fifth and sixth books and the appendices under the title ''The Return of the King''
column3: in reference to [[Aragorn]]'s assumption of the throne. Tolkien indicated he would have preferred ''The War of the Ring'' as a title
column4: as it gave away less of the story; but he was overruled by his publishers.

column1: ==Structure==
The structure of ''The Return of the King'' mirrors somewhat that of ''The Two Towers'' in that the first section recounts the various adventures of several characters including a massive battle
column2: and the second section resumes the quest of the [[Ring-bearers]].

column1: * Book V: The War of the Ring
* Book VI: The End of the Third Age
